T77H391 |rad2modif = Mini PCIe (oversized) |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 1300 |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = |rad2cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== There is a ''[[SMSC]]'' USB2514B USB 2.0 Hub on-board. *OEM: [[Foxconn]] (Hon Hai) / [[Ambit]] [https://github.com/mirror/dd-wrt/blob/master/src/router/netgear/ambitCfg-r6300.h U12H218T00] {{WiFiCert|WFA17018|12/10/2012}} ===HW Dissection=== *[http://www.chipworks.com/blog/recentteardowns/2012/09/04/comparing-netgears-r6300-and-r6200-ac-routers-big-wins-for-broadcom-and-skyworks/ '''Chipworks''''s dissection] (nice images) :''Macronix'' MX25L1606EM2I-12G 16Mbit (2MB) Serial Flash :''[[Samsung]]'' K9F1G08U0D 1Gbit (128MB) NAND Flash :[[Broadcom]] BCM53125 switch, ''[[SMSC]]'' USB25148 USB 2.0 Hub :''[[Foxconn]]'' P/N T77H391 BCM4360 wireless module (same P/N and :[[Broadcom]] ref. design for the BCM4352 module in the [[Netgear R6200]]) :silkscreened with "BCM94360MCH5" and the [[Foxconn]] P/N "T77H391" :noted the dies for the BCM4360 and BCM4352 as being the same. ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.downloads.netgear.com/files/R6300_UM_1Jun12.pdf Manual] ===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31772-first-look-netgear-r6300-wifi-router-80211ac-dual-band-gigabit ''First look - Netgear R6300 router'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :Default SSIDs of NETGEAR57 and NETGEAR57-5G *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31799-netgear-r6300-wifi-router-80211ac-dual-band-gigabit-full-review ''Netgear R6300'' review on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :indicates the switch chip is a [[Broadcom]] BCM53115 ::(contradicted by the ''SkyWorks'' dissection below) :2.4GHz - [[Broadcom]] BCM4331 + 3x [[Skyworks]] SE2594L ::(Dual Band 802.11a/b/g/n Wireless LAN Front End) :5GHz - [[Broadcom]] BCM4360 + 3x [[Skyworks]] SE5003L ::(5GHz, 23dBm Power Amp w/ Power Detector) *[http://www.foxnetwork.ru/index.php/en/component/content/article/130-netgear-r6300.html Reviewed on '''Foxnetwork'''] (w/ photos [internal, external, and UI]) : 84:1B:5E OUI; NETGEARXX and NETGEARXX-5G SSIDs ===Forum threads=== *[http://www.myopenrouter.com/article/46049/Inside-the-NETGEAR-R6300-JTAG-Pinouts-USB-TTL-Extension-Pics...-Plus-DD-WRT-Kong-Mod-is-Coming/ ''Kong's shot of the board w/ serial header connected'' on '''MyOpenRouter'''] *[http://www.dd-wrt.pl/forum/viewtopic.php?p=871333 ''Shot of the header section'' on the '''DD-WRT''' forums] ===Other=== *[http://www.anandtech.com/show/5836/netgear-announces-2stream-80211ac-r6200-router-and-a6200-usb-20-adapter ''Netgear R6200 router and A6200 USB 2.0 adapter'' on '''AnandTech'''] :Processor noted as the [[Broadcom]] BCM4706 ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== J251 (presumably JTAG) ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== The serial header is '''J252'''. 
              J252
(3.3) (TxD) (...) (...) (RxD) (GND)
Pin1  Pin2  Pin3  Pin4  Pin5  Pin6
|
v
to J251 (presumably JTAG)
{{/Serial info}} ==Pictures==
'''Retail Images''' File:Netgear R6300 01.jpg| File:Netgear R6300 02.jpg| File:Netgear R6300 03.jpg|
[[Has images::retail| ]][[Has images::external| ]] ==Notes== ===GPIO=== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Pin ! Function ! enable ! disable |- | 15 | WAN LED
(Internet) | orange | green |- | 14 | unknown | | |- | 13 | unknown | | |- | 12 | unknown | | |- | 11 | Wireless LED
(WiFi 5GHz) | off | on |- | 10 | unknown | | |- | 9 | Right LOGO LED
(WiFi 2.4GHz) | off | on |- | 8 | USB LED | off | on |- | 7 | unknown | | |- | 6 | unknown | | |- | 5 | unknown | | |- | 4 | unknown | | |- | 3 | Power LED
(amber) | green | orange |- | 2 | Power LED
(green) | off | on |- | 1 | Left LOGO LED | off | on |- | 0 | unknown | | |} Use the following dd-wrt console startup script to turn off the NETGEAR logo. 
gpio enable 9
gpio enable 1
[[Category:English Documentation]]
